com.barrysheehan.www

Class TextSimplifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.barrysheehan.www.TextSimplifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextSwapper

    public class TextSimplifier
extends java.lang.Object
implements TextSwapper
    Simplifies a String passed to it and returns a simplified version of the String. Is configured with a Thesaurus object, used to swap words in input text with other predefined words.

    Is configured with the path to a dictionary file dictionaryFile and a word list file wordListFile which contain paths to .txt files. The files at these paths are used to create a Thesaurus object specific to this instance of TextSimplifier.

    Since:
    1.8
    See Also:
    TextSwapper, TextSimplifierInteractable, Thesaurus

      • isConfigured

        public boolean isConfigured()
        Returns boolean value stored at configured instance variable.

        Used to determine whether the current TextSimplifier object has been configured.

        Returns:
        boolean stored at the configured instance variable

      • init

        public void init()
        Creates a Thesaurus object to be used in simplification operations and sets the configured instance variable to true.

        Informs the user that TextSimplifier is being initialised with a new Thesaurus, and when the initialisation is done.

        This method must be called each time the dictionaryFile or wordListFile are changed, otherwise the Thesaurus being used will not contain the updated dictionary or word list.

      • swapText

        public java.lang.String swapText(java.lang.String inputText)
        Simplifies a String supplied to it by testing each word within it against the keys stored in the wordMap variable of thesaurus, swapping words when appropriate and returning the simplified text.

      • testWord

        public boolean testWord(java.lang.String word)

        Specified by:
        testWord in interface TextSwapper
        Parameters:
        word - a word to be tested
        Returns:
